person.persName: Albert Seaton Berry (Campbell County, KY, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Campbell County, Kentucky, native. Son of James Taylor Berry and Elizabeth Wise Berry. Graduated from Miami University in Butler County, Ohio, in 1855. Graduated from the Cincinnati Law School in Cincinnati in 1858. Attended school in Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Campbell County in 1850. Attorney in Campbell County in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Campbell County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from 1862 to 1863. Served in the Confederate States Marine Corps as a second lieutenant from February 14, 1863, to April 6, 1865. Captured at the Battle of Sailor's Creek, Prince Edward County, Virginia, on April 6, 1865. Prisoner of war at Old Capitol Prison, Washington, D.C, and Johnson's Island, Erie County, Ohio, from April 1865 to June 5, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on July 1, 1865.
